qas.question: In what year was Hannes Oberhauser identified as a guardian of James Bond?
Who were the writers of Spectre?
Which group in previous Bond films was changed to be a part of Spectre instead of its own entity?
What is the name of the short story in which Hannes Oberhauser appeared?
Who was Bond's full time guardian?
In which Bond story did the name Oberhauser first appear?
In which movie was the Quantum organization first introduced?
Quantum is a division of what other organization?
What was considered a copycat story?
Who has permanent legal custody of Bond in 1983?

plausible_answers.text: a minor retcon to the continuity of the previous films

qas.question: Producer Neal Purvis revealed that the film would provide what?
What is alluded to in Royale Casino?

context: Despite being an original story, <a9_0><b10_0>Spectre<b10_0/><a9_0/> draws on Ian Fleming's source material, most notably in the character of Franz Oberhauser, played by <a0_0><a7_0>Christoph Waltz<a0_0/>.<a7_0/> Oberhauser shares his name with <b11_0>Hannes Oberhauser<b11_0/>, a background character in the short story "<a4_0><a6_0>Octopussy<a6_0/><a4_0/>" from the Octopussy and The Living Daylights collection, and who is named in the film as having been a temporary legal guardian of a young Bond in <a1_0>1983<a1_0/>. Similarly, <a5_0>Charmian Bond<a5_0/> is shown to have been his full-time guardian, observing the back story established by Fleming. With the acquisition of the rights to Spectre and its associated characters, screenwriters <a2_0>Neal Purvis and Robert Wade<a2_0/> revealed that the film would provide <b12_0>a minor retcon to the continuity of the previous films<b12_0/>, with <b13_0>the <a3_0>Quantum<a3_0/> organisation<b13_0/> alluded to in Casino Royale and introduced in <a8_0>Quantum of Solace<a8_0/> reimagined as a division within Spectre rather than an independent organisation.
